attributes.action: Abolish the Tolls on both Severn Crossings and return ownership to the British Public.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: This petition is to end the tolls (or at least reduce them) on both Severn Crossings. Over 26 million people a year use these bridges which generates profits in excess of £70m p/a.  Currently the bridges are owned by a Private Company and won't fall into britsh public ownership until £1bn of Tolls has been collected. The Second severn crossing cost £300m to build and as of 2006 - £684m had been collected in tolls, effectivly paying for the bridge twice. Do we really have to pay for it a third time ?
